docs.title: Material for Mkdocs Insiders YML example
docs.text:
This project is a template of the YML configuration I use for my Material for Mkdocs projects. It also displays an example layout populated by a guide.

Read the YML View the layout

Read the setup guide to get started and take a look at the useage page to see most of the possible options and their render.

I use the paid Insiders version

This template wont work unless you sponsor Squidfunk

docs.title: Setup and useage guide for Material for Mkdocs Insiders
docs.text:
This guide aims to help you start your project with Insiders as fast as possible using my template.

Assuming you are a personal user with a Linux server, the setup guide swill show you how to start ASAP and the useage page can be used as a referance for most of the possible options.

docs.title: Preface
docs.text:
Please keep in mind that the official documentation at squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/ is way better and should be used instead of this.

Only use this guide if you want to have a working example to copy-paste once you understand the real documentation.

Insiders paid version

This guide only works with Material Insiders

Environment

This guide is for self-hosting on Linux. For other hosting and deployment options, please refer to the offical doc once again.

docs.title: Downloads
docs.text:
Here are all the downloads you'll need to do.

apt install python3 libcairo2-dev libfreetype6-dev libffi-dev libjpeg-dev libpng-dev libz-dev pngquant
pip install "mkdocs-material[imaging]"
pip install mkdocs-rss-plugin
pip install mkdocs-git-committers-plugin-2
pip install mkdocs-git-revision-date-localized-plugin
pip install mkdocs-glightbox

docs.title: Material for Mkdocs Insiders
docs.text:
Aquire Material for Mkfocs insiders. The post-bill GitHub page along this one should have all the information you need.

Once you're done, proceed with Getting started with Insiders.

docs.title: linux commands
docs.text:
It's extemely simple !

First, create a new project:

mkdocs new my-project
cd my-project

Inside the new folder, you will find the basic layout of an Mkdocs project.

This is where you can copy-paste my template (cloneable from https://github.com/FlagHunter01/mkdocs-yml.git).

In order to preview your site, use the following command and go to localhost:8000:

mkdocs serve

Once ou're done, generate the HTML with:

mkdocs buid

The code will be availible at \site\.

docs.title: VSCode
docs.text: If you are using Visual Studio Code, you can add two modules that will greatly enhance your experience.

docs.title: TODO Highlight v2
docs.text: Download TODO Highlight v2 to highlight all the TODO: tags in my files. It's an easy way to keep in mind all the options that need to be customized befor you start writing your documentation.

docs.title: YAML by RedHat
docs.text:
Download YAML by RedHat and paste the following in the JSON settings in order to have the official Material for Mkdocs debug:

{
    "yaml.schemas": {
        "https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/schema.json": "mkdocs.yml"
    },
    "yaml.customTags": [ 
        "!ENV scalar",
        "!ENV sequence",
        "tag:yaml.org,2002:python/name:material.extensions.emoji.to_svg",
        "tag:yaml.org,2002:python/name:material.extensions.emoji.twemoji",
        "tag:yaml.org,2002:python/name:pymdownx.superfences.fence_code_format"
    ]
}

docs.title: Using markdown
docs.text:
Here are some basics of markdown. 

Text

*Italic*

**Bold**

# Main title (1 per doc)

## Title

### Subtitle

[Link](http://url.com)

![Image](../images/cat.jpg))

| Table | Example |
|-------|---------|
| 1     | Banana  |
| 2     | Apple   |

Output

Text

Italic

Bold

docs.title: Subtitle
docs.text:
Link

Table Example 1 Banana 2 Apple

docs.title: Note to self - plugins acting up
docs.text:
If socials or blog or projects starts giving strange errors, even after downloading the latest Insiders version, try this:

pip install mkdocs-material mkdocs-material-extensions --upgrade
pip install pillow cairosvg --upgrade

docs.title: Metadata
docs.text:
Each page has configurable metadata, that can be definded at the beggining as flollows:

---
title: Useage
subtitle: Material for Mkdocs Insiders only
description: This page contains most of the markdown options offered by Material Insiders. 
status: new (I don't use those)
---

docs.title: Admonitions
docs.text:
Note

This is a simple note.

This is a note without title.

This is a note with a title and a body

This is the body of the note with a title and a body.

Notes can nest anything

Like other notes

Or code blocks
!!! note "Notes can nest anything"
    !!! example "Like other notes"
This is a collapsible note

Its body is hidden.

This is an un-collapsed collapsible note

Its body is visible by default.

This note is inline, at the end of the line

Note

Abstract

Info

Tip

Success

Question

Warning

Failure

Danger

Bug

Example

Quote

docs.title: Annotations
docs.text:
You can annotate text (1)

  1. Annotations can nest anything like code blocs or admonitions.

Phasellus posuere in sem ut cursus (1)

  1. Like here !

docs.title: Buttons
docs.text: Primary button Peasant button

docs.title: Code
docs.text:
This is inline code

This is a code block
Full-option block
if (a == b)
{
    Tim = llama // (1)!
    // This is highlighted
}
  1. Place ! after the annotation to make the comment character disappear !

docs.title: Content tabs
docs.text:
AB

This is some content

This is some other content

Content tabs can be liked. For example, Selecting "B" will select it for all content tabs.

AB

You shouldn't see this if you selected "B"

You should see this if you selected "B".

You can nest everything inside tabs, and tabs can be nested inside everything.

docs.title: Tables
docs.text: Simple Table Sugar Bad Water Good Left-aligned Middle-aligned Right-aligned Test Test Test

docs.title: Diagrams
docs.text: Material allows some neat diagrams but I don't really use those.

docs.title: Foornotes
docs.text:
The footnote is at the foot of the page 1.

With Insiders they can be displayed as tooltips.

docs.title: Formatting
docs.text:
Text can be deleted and replacement text added. This can also be combined into onea single operation. Highlighting is also possible and comments can be added inline.

Formatting can also be applied to blocks by putting the opening and closing tags on separate lines and adding new lines between the tags and the content.

  • This was marked (highlight)
  • This was inserted (underline)

  • This was deleted (strikethrough)

  • H2O

  • ATA

Ctrl+Alt+Del

docs.text:

    Change the colors, fonts, language, icons, logo and more with a few lines

    Customization

    Material for MkDocs is licensed under MIT and available on [GitHub]

    License

  • Donec vitae suscipit est
  • Nulla tempor lobortis orci

  2. Donec vitae suscipit est
  3. Nulla tempor lobortis orci
Content tabs
=== "Unordered list"

    * Donec vitae suscipit est

=== "Ordered list"
